definitions.text: move about aimlessly or without any destination, often in search of food or employment
examples: The cattle roam across the prairie
the laborers drift from one town to the next
They rolled from town to town

definitions.text: be sexually unfaithful to one's partner in marriage
go via an indirect route or at no set pace
examples: After dinner, we wandered into town

definitions.text: to move or cause to move in a sinuous, spiral, or circular course
examples: the river winds through the hills
the path meanders through the vineyards
sometimes, the gout wanders through the entire body

definitions.text: lose clarity or turn aside especially from the main subject of attention or course of argument in writing, thinking, or speaking
examples: She always digresses when telling a story
Don't digress when you give a lecture
